III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination or restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
1

condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/02/23, staff member asked youth to sit down, and they
requested to go outside instead but was told no as this was out of
bounds. The youth acted as though they were going to go outside,
and the staff member grabbed the hood of youth's sweatshirt and
pulled him back by the neck. Staff member was tossing youth
around and caused youth to twist their ankle. Youth's ankle is still
sore today, 12/08/23.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed on December 12, 2023, and did
not have any further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
December 13, 2023. Youth A said on December 2, 2023, another
youth in his house was “going off” and one of the staff called
Supervisor to assist with the situation because the staff thought
Youth A was going to “jump” the other youth. Youth A said
Supervisor arrived at the house and told him to either clean the
house or sit at the table to which he responded that he did not
want to, and Supervisor could not make him if he was “outside,
out of bounds”. Youth A said he sat in the dining room and put on
his shoes and started to walk to the door however Supervisor was
standing by the door, so he turned to start going down the stairs to
the basement. Youth A said once he began walking down the
stairs, Supervisor “grabbed the hood” of his sweatshirt and
“pulled” him outside. Youth A said once outside, Supervisor
immediately placed him in a standing benevolent hold and started
making comments like “you think your grown”, “always talking stuff
to staff”, and “you think your big going after little kids”. Youth A
said he responded to these comments by stating “what are you
going to do about it” at which time Supervisor picked him up off
the ground and began to “toss him around”. Youth A said when
Supervisor placed his feet back on the ground Youth A rolled his
ankle. Youth A said Supervisor then made a plan to let him go as
long as he went inside and sat at the table, took a shower, took
his medications, and went to bed. Youth A said once he was
released, he went inside and sat at the table and Supervisor left
the house. Youth A said no other youth or staff witnessed the
restraint as they were all inside. Youth A said he did not tell any
staff about the restraint or that he had hurt his ankle. Youth A said
on Monday, December 4, 2023, he talked to the medical staff
about his ankle. Youth A denied his ankle becoming swollen or
2

bruised. Youth A said medical sent him to have an x-ray of his
ankle and it came back “normal”.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 13, 2023. Staff 1 said he was working in Gerber house
on December 2, 2023. Staff 1 said a youth was upset and began
antagonizing his peers which upset Youth A. Staff 1 said Youth A
began to try to “fight” the other youth, so the on-call supervisor
was called for assistance in the house. Staff 1 said Supervisor
arrived at the house and directed him to pass the youth’s
medication while Supervisor deescalated Youth A. Staff 1 said he
was passing youth’s medications and between youth he saw
Supervisor had Youth A in a benevolent hold on the porch. Staff 1
said he was not present for the initiation of the restraint however
when he witnessed the restraint it was being done appropriately.
Staff 1 said he went between watching the restraint and
supervising the other youth in the house. Staff 1 said he checked
on the restraint three to four times and was present for the end of
the restraint when a plan was made for Youth A to shower,
complete his house duty, and go to bed. Staff 1 said at no time did
he see Supervisor lifting Youth A up off the ground. Staff 1 said
after the restraint ended and Youth A came inside, Supervisor left
to go assist in another house. Staff 1 said he debriefed with Youth
A that evening and stated Youth A did not have any concerns
about the restraint and did not report any injury to him.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 13, 2023. Supervisor said he was on-call on December
2, 2023, and was helping in many houses on campus throughout
that entire day. Supervisor said he was called over to assist at
Gerber house due to one youth being in a restraint and Youth A
trying to assault that youth while in the hold. Supervisor said he
arrived, and the table had been flipped over and the other youth
pointed to Youth A, indicating he flipped the table over.
Supervisor said he went down the bedroom hallway to check on
the youth that was in a restraint and could hear the youth getting
louder and louder out in the living room area. Supervisor said he
walked back into the living room area and Youth A was arguing
with Staff 1. Supervisor said Staff 1 was trying to challenge Youth
A's thinking and Youth A was getting upset and verbally
aggressive towards Staff 1. Supervisor said he told Staff 1 to “let it
go” and Youth A stated he “does what he wants” to which
Supervisor said, “not while he is at Gerber program” and Youth A
responded, “then I won’t be here”. Supervisor said Youth A went
to his room, got on socks and attempted to walk downstairs to get
his shoes. Supervisor said Staff 1 blocked Youth A from getting
3

downstairs so he walked outside onto the porch and Supervisor
attempted to block him from going off the porch. Supervisor said
Youth A was physically trying to push past him to get off the porch
so he initiated a benevolent restraint. Supervisor said Youth A was
verbally threatening both him and Staff 1 while in the restraint.
Supervisor said eventually Youth A began to calm down and was
willing to make a plan to go inside and clean up the kitchen and
take his medications. Supervisor said once released, Youth A
went inside and sat at the table and was provided his medications.
Supervisor said he left shortly after that due to needing to assist in
another house. Supervisor directed Staff 1 to debrief the restraint
with Youth A and later called the house to ensure that had
occurred. Supervisor said Youth A never disclosed any injury from
the restraint. Supervisor denied grabbing Youth A by the hood of a
sweatshirt, noting he believed he was in a t-shirt. Supervisor
denied ever picking Youth A up off the ground during the restraint.
Supervisor said he placed Youth A in a restraint due to him
threatening and attempting to leave the house, it being hunting
season, and bears still being active on campus creating an unsafe
situation for Youth A.
Video Review:
Video footage of December 2, 2023, Gerber house
kitchen/entry way area, was reviewed on December 13, 2023.
The video reviewed showed Youth A walk to the entryway and
Supervisor stand in front of the door. The video showed Youth A
and Supervisor go outside together at the same time however did
not show Supervisor grab Youth A by the hood to get him out the
door. The remainder of the incident was not able to be viewed on
video as it occurred outside.
Documents Reviewed:
• Supervisor’s personnel file: Supervisor completed Aegis
restraint training on February 8, 2023, and May 31, 2023.
Supervisor had one disciplinary action on file from March 9,
2021, for an unwarranted restraint.
• Incident Report 169150222 dated December 2, 2023, for
Youth A’s restraint with Supervisor. The incident report is
consistent with Supervisor’s interview.
• Medical Documentation from Eagle Village nursing staff for
Youth A was reviewed. Youth A had a previous medical
note on 10/31/23 and 11/1/23 for rolling his ankle during a
basketball game. Youth A was seen on 12/12/23 for “ankle
pain” and given Tylenol.
• Corewell Health after visit summary dated December 12,
2023, for Youth A. The reason for the visit was “ankle pain”
4

and the diagnosis was “sprain of right ankle, unspecified
ligament, initial encounter” the summary gave educational
material for how an ankle sprain may occur and how to
treat it at home. There was no further follow up required.
There was no indication how it may have occurred or when
it may have occurred.
• DCWL has granted approval for youth to be restrained if a
youth is going towards the woods or in an area where
bears have been actively seen on campus. Vice President
of Programming said ongoing bear sightings have occurred
and Gerber house is one of the houses located in the
woods and in an area where bear have been seen.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with resident restraint.
Supervisor placed Youth A in a restraint due his attempt to run
away and the ongoing sighting of bear on campus. In addition,
there is no evidence that during the restraint Supervisor performed
an inappropriate restraint or hurt Youth A in anyway.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
